name: Chamber of Dice
description:
Video: 

Chamber of dice

How to play  (min 3-5 players)

Small dice determine movements, every move is + 2. 

Larger dice determine the power. 

You cannot move diagonally, take careful steps. 

Brave Souls

Demon

  • Objective of this mission is to collect each parts to forge the Grand Crystal. You must collect players number + 1 amount of each parts.  
  • When you arrive at the station, you must pick a card. It will show what numbers are needed. First, roll 3 larger dices at once. You have 3 rolling chances. A dice with corresponding face will be placed on top of the card. Each scored dice equals to 1 part. 
  • Each classes have strengths and weakness. Their own professional parts give + 2 throws, total of 5. And weakness station… you will throw 1 time less, total of 2 throws. 
  • Each classes have abilities, you can use your turn to activate it. You must have 3 rounds cooldown, use the blue cooldown token to symbolise your ability usage to your crew and the demon. 
  • You must rush to collect parts and return to the base to drop off parts. You can leave parts at the empty square. 
  • Be CAREFUL! The Demon will set traps, you must roll a larger dice to fight its trick. A larger number win. at your victory, you will be stopped at the tile without harm, but at your defeat, you will lose a heart or a part. 
  • The map has trap markers, 2 per brave souls. 
  • If you have no possession of a particular type of a part, you can go to its station to obtain the parts. Remember, you must have 0 possessions of the part you want to challenge. 
  • YOU DEMON! You will start with a replica map and a wall surrounding yourself. No Souls should be able to have a peek at your evil plans. 
  • As you wish, you will determine players movement. Throw small dices, always one more than the number of the Souls. 
  • Before the game starts, you can place 4 traps. 

Remember…

  1. You cannot place a trap in 1 tile radius of the soul. 
  1. The green tiles are trap free during the first round. 
  1. No new traps in the 1 tile radius of an existing trap. 
  1. You will get 4 traps per soul. 
  1. Each round, you will gain the same amount as the starting traps. After reaching (number of the Soul x 4) traps, you can change (number of the Souls) traps location during your turn.
